subject: Law
title: Torture: Absolute Prohibition
description: A quick win: understand Torture: Absolute Prohibition.

hook.text: A bomb is about to explode. A suspect knows where. Can you torture them to find out? International law says no.

buildup.text: The prohibition of torture is absolute under international law. No exceptions‚Äînot war, not emergency, not terrorism.

discovery.text: The UN Convention Against Torture (1984) defines torture and requires states to criminalize it.

twist.text: After 9/11, the US used 'enhanced interrogation techniques' that many legal scholars and courts called torture.

climax.text: The 'ticking bomb' scenario is a thought experiment. In practice, torture produces unreliable information.

punchline.text: No exception. No justification. The ban on torture is absolute.

quiz.question: Are there exceptions to the international ban on torture?
